name: RemoveUserFromSegment
description:
Remove users from a manual segment by ID.

Use this tool to remove users from a manual segment by specifying their IDs. Note that this functionality requires each user to have an 'id' attribute, and cannot be used for data-driven segments.

parameters.name: segment_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the segment. Found on the segment's page in the dashboard under 'Usage'.

value_schema.description: The identifier for a segment. You can find your segment's ID on its page in the dashboard—go to *Segments*, select your segment, and find the ID under *Usage*. Or you can find your segment using the [App API](#tag/Segments).

parameters.name: identification_type
parameters.description: The type of identifiers used for the users to be removed. Options are 'id', 'email', or 'cio_id'. Defaults to 'id' if not specified.

value_schema.description: The type of `ids` you want to use. All of the values in the `ids` array must be of this type. If you don't provide this parameter, we assume that the `ids` array contains `id` values.

parameters.name: customer_ids_to_remove
parameters.description: A JSON array of customer IDs to be removed from the segment. Limited to 1000 IDs per request.

ids.description: The customer IDs you want to remove from the segment.
